Restaurant inspection scores in Chapel Hill

Health department evaluates eateries near campus

An employee at Cosmic Cantina makes a burrito. Cosmic was one of 15 restaurants that didn't receive a critical violation when inspected.

Photo by Jacki Huntington reesenews
  • By Shane Ryan
  • reesenews multimedia journalist
Feb. 02 12:31 am
  • 90778 commentshttp%3A%2F%2Freesenews.org%2F2011%2F02%2F02%2Frestaurant-inspection-scores-in-chapel-hill%2F9077%2FRestaurant+inspection+scores+in+Chapel+Hill2011-02-02+05%3A31%3A21Shane+Ryanhttp%3A%2F%2Freesenews.org%2F%3Fp%3D9077
  • E-mail
  • Print

Do you like this story?

CHAPEL HILL
Reesenews has aggregated the latest health inspection results for restaurants in and around downtown Chapel Hill.

The information, available online at the Orange County Department of Health, includes the date of each restaurant’s last inspection, the final grade, whether the restaurant had critical violations and a sample of the violations themselves.

Although each restaurant managed to score 90 or above on their latest inspection, environmental health specialists found that 82 percent had critical sanitation violations.

These are documented in the table below.

Eyebrow-raising violations

Elaine’s: This upscale West Franklin Street restaurant scored an 88 (B) on October 21st, 2010. Among the listed violations were:

  • Heavy slime mold build-up in the ice box
  • Soup and vegetables held at improper temperatures
  • Dirty shelves in the walk-in cooler
  • A bartender caught handling ice with his bare hands during the inspector’s visit

The inspection was repeated less than a month later, and Elaine’s raised their score to a 95.5.  Still, seven violations were noted, including one of a critical nature.

Good Fellows: Last inspected in October 2009, this basement karaoke bar:

  • Stored food in the beer cooler
  • Lacked soap dispensers at the hand sink
  • Had slime mold in the ice machine
  • Had weak sanitizer in the dish washing machine.

Two of these violations were critical, and while the health department requires each restaurant to be inspected at least once per year, there is no online health department record of any inspection at Good Fellows in 2010.

Pepper’s Pizza: Scored an 85 (B) on December 22nd, 2010, and committed five critical violations:

  • Inspectors found “potentially hazardous foods” kept at insufficiently cool temperatures
  • Entire pizzas for sale more than two hours after being cooked
  • Dirty towels in the hand sink.

Pepper’s received a repeat inspection last month and raised their overall score to 93 despite:

  • Mold growing in the kitchen sink
  • An employee witnessed scooping ice with an unapproved cup
  • Three violations from the previous inspection repeated

Employees caught red-handed:

  • A female employee at Bonne Soiree, a French restaurant on West Franklin, was seen washing cloths in a sink designated for hand washing only.
  • At Sakura Xpress, an employee cutting beef roast was observed perspiring over the food without a hair net.
  • At Quiznos, an employee handled money and food without washing his hands between transactions.

At least one employee tried to talk his way out of a violation. When an inspector found sanitizer at the wrong concentration at Lantern, a manager said the employee who made the solution was out for the day.

Chain restaurants

Fast-food joints fared quite well, with McDonald’s scoring 100, Papa John’s and Panera Bread 99.5, and Chipotle 99.

Quiznos on East Franklin was a rare exception; the sandwich shop scored a 90, tied for the lowest of any restaurant investigated. Aside from the aforementioned hand-washing violation, mildew was found in the lemonade dispenser and cold foods were held at insufficiently cool temperatures.

Despite a relatively high score at Starbucks, inspectors discovered flies in the service area and slime mold in equipment drains.

The strangest violations

Flies were also present at Don Jose Tienda Mexicana, but these weren’t the only insects on the premises– German roaches were spotted near the walk-in freezer. Somehow, the bugs weren’t even Don Jose’s most critical violation; that distinction belonged to their practice of storing frozen pork loins in grocery bags.

Improper storage was a common theme throughout. The oddest example may have belonged to Mama Dip’s, who saw fit to keep their yams in a beverage unit.

The most inexplicable violation, though, came at Mint. In the midst of docking the restaurant 1.5 points for improper storage, Inspector 2332 “observed pika on (the) floor in walk-in.”

A pika is a small mammal similar to a rabbit, and is not on Mint’s menu. Whether this is a typo or some other misunderstanding is unclear. Whatever the case, an employee removed the item at the inspector’s behest.

The lowest and highest scores

The four lowest scores in the table belonged to Quiznos Subs, Asia Cafe, Cafe Trilussa and Gumby’s Pizza. Each restaurant scored a 90, the bare minimum for achieving an A.

Critiques of these restaurants were particularly worrisome; Asia Cafe had unlabeled bottles of chemicals, Cafe Trilussa stored cooking utensils in “dirty, stagnant water,” and none of Gumby’s Pizza employees wore hair restraints.

The best scores belonged to Noodles & Company (101), Ye Olde Waffle Shop (100.5), McDonald’s, and both Caribou Coffee locations (100).

Restaurants without critical violations

  • Cosmic Cantina
  • Crepes Veronique
  • Jimmy John’s
  • Italian Pizzeria III
  • Windows at the Franklin Hotel
  • 35 Chinese
  • Artichoke Basil
  • Bandido’s Mexican Cafe
  • Chipotle
  • The Crunkleton
  • Vimala’s Curry Blossom Cafe
  • Panera Bread
  • Papa John’s Pizza
  • Ye Olde Waffle Shop
  • Noodles & Company.

View the entire table

*Note: The restaurants investigated are in and around downtown Chapel Hill. If a franchise has two locations in town but only appears once in the table, it refers to the location closest to downtown. A restaurant’s maximum score is 100, but two points can be gained on the final grade if an on-site manager has passed an approved training course and the corresponding test. 

Restaurant Date Grade Critical Violations? Problems
35 Chinese 6/1/10 99 N Nymphs (insects) in dry storage, dishes not dried before stacking, rusted and unclean shelves, food and grease remnants on walls
411 West 4/16/10 96.5 Y Cold foods not held at proper temperatures in grill, unlabeled chemicals
Acme Food and Beverage 9/24/10 93 Y Food in prep coolers too hot, soups and sauces re-heated improperly, dishes washed without sanitizer, mildew on cutting boards
Artichoke Basil 8/18/10 99 N Meatballs thawed at room temperature
Asia Café 4/3/10 90 Y Cold food not held at proper temperatures, bottles of chemicals without proper labels, excessive garbage near walk-in cooler
Bandido’s Mexican Café 6/17/10 99 N House flies in dining areas, rusty refrigerator shelves
Bonne Soiree 10/21/10 98.5 Y Waitress seen washing cloths in sink reserved for hand-washing, dishwasher missing hair restraint, unapproved mandolin slicer
Breadmen’s Restaurant & Catering 5/10/10 92 Y Food preparation done with more than “minimal” use of bare hands, hot and cold foods not stored at proper temperatures, kitchen floor, walls, and ceiling in disrepair
Boston Market 11/23/10 92.5 Y Hot foods not stored at proper temperaturs, mold in storage units
Brueggers Bagel Bakery 6/28/10 96.5 Y Hot chicken in holding unit below required temperature
Buns 4/14/10 95 Y Employees observed handling trash and food without washing hands in between, chicken stored improperly on top of beef, female preparer observed without hair restraint
Butternut Squash Restaurant 5/18/10 98 Y No sanitizer for dish washing machine
Café Trilussa 10/21/10 90 Y No soap at kitchen lavatory, food contact surfaces unclean, cooking utensils stored in dirty, stagnant water, unclean stoves and shelves
Caribou Coffee West Franklin 8/12/10 100 Y Kitchen sanitizer unavailable
Caribou Coffee East Franklin 8/9/10 100 Y Kitchen sanitizer unavailable, non-food items stored on the floor
Carolina Brewery 4/19/10 95.5 Y Raw fish, chicken, and beef improperly stored on top of ready-to-eat vegetables, dishes stacked before drying, dust build-up on shelves
Carolina Coffee Shop 6/2/10 95 Y Slime mold build up in ice machine, ceiling, floors, and walls in disrepair, foods stored in wrong top-to-bottom order (beef over canadian bacon)
Carolina Crossroads 6/7/10 95 Y Food stored in incorrect order, beef not cooked to proper temperature, hand washing signs missing
Carrburritos 5/14/10 99 Y Guacamole not kept at sufficiently cold temperatures, dishes not dried before stacking
Chipotle 3/4/10 99 N Hot water unavailable at tap, faulty gasket on prep cooler
Cosmic Cantina 4/3/10 97 N Mislabeled foods, cracked floors, missing handwashing sign
Crepes Veronique 9/7/10 97 N Water in prep sinks not sufficiently hot, items stored on floor, wooden flooring in kitchen in disrepair
Crook’s Corner 10/28/09 96 Y No sanitizer for bar or dining room (“windex is not a sanitizer”), empty bleach bucket, rusty, dusty shelves
Cypress on the Hill 4/26/10 96 Y Food remnants on washed plates, dirty ice machines, “purple-like liquid” without labels
Don Jose 7/28/20 91.5 Y Pork loins stored in grocery bags, sanitizer in dish washing sink too weak, german roaches near the walk-in freezer, open dumpster door swarmed by flying insects, unapproved wooden cheese slicer
East End Oyster Bar 10/14/09 95 Y Paper towels not available at hand sinks, sanitizers at wrong concentration, dirty soda gun nozzles, bottled beer coolers used to store food
Elaine’s 11/4/10 95.5 Y Dirty cutting boards, wiping cloths used to handle fresh foods, peeling paint on kitchen floor, unapproved gelato machine
Four Corners 8/24/10 94.5 Y No sanitizer in food preparation area, cold food in prep units stored at high temperatures, dirty walls, toaster, and microwave area.
Franklin Street Pizza and Pasta 6/14/10 94 Y Employee drinks located too close to food, slime mold on drink dispenser, cheese not stored at cold temperatures, mold on shelving units
Fuse 6/18/10 95 Y Mildew in ice bin, no kitchen sanitizer, broken wall tiles, exposed sheetrock
Good Fellows 10/14/09 91.5 Y No soap dispensers in sink, slime mold in ice machine, weak sanitizer in dish washing machine, ice scoops stored on dusty surface, beer coolers used to store food
Granville Tower’s Café 6/7/10 96 Y Turkey, ham, and butter not stored at cool temperatures, dirty floors, unlabeled powdered sugar
Gumby’s Pizza 4/3/10 90 Y Ketchup prepped in kitchen sink, stored on floor, unlabeled chemical bottles, employees without hair restraints, unclean prep sink, no paper towels in restroom
I Love NY Pizza 4/7/10 95 Y Pizzas without a time label left out, employees without hair restraints, no paper towels in restrooms
India Palace 5/28/10 98 Y slime mold in ice machine, uncovered food in walk-in refrigerator, baked potatoes stored on floor, unapproved flooring materials
Italian Pizzeria III 11/11/10 98.5 N Counters in disrepair, unclean dumpster area
Jack Sprat Café 4/15/10 93 Y Hand sink in bar blocked, heavy slime mold accumulation in ice machine, BBQ not held at cool temperatures, wine refrigerator used for food storage, dusty kitchen vents
Jimmy Johns 12/2/10 97.5 N Moldy caulking on wall, wastewater spilling on floor
Joe’s Joint 4/13/10 93 Y Chlorine sanitizer mixed too strong, hot water unavailable, employee personal shaving items stored with cleaned equipment, broken freezer, unapproved wooden Canadian freezer
Kildare’s Irish Pub 9/20/10 96 Y Dish washing machine not sanitizing, unclean soda dispenser, unclean cutting boards, prep unit foods stored at wrong temperature, improper sugar and flour scoop
Kurama Sushi and Noodle Express 4/7/10 95.5 Y Dust accumulation on vents in kitchen, silverware improperly stored, rusted shelves, sushi rice held at improper temperatures
L’Incontro Pizza 7/27/10 98 Y Weak sanitizer mix in sink, food improperly stored in grocery bags
La Residence 6/17/10 98 Y Weak Sanitizer mix in sink, dishes not dry prior to stacking, unused sanitizer test strips
Lantern 5/3/10 95.5 Y Employees washing hands in prep sink, weak sanitizer, rusted shelf
Lime & Basil 5/4/10 98.5 Y Pre-heated chicken not held at sufficiently hot temperature, noodles not labeled with date/time information
Linda’s Bar and Grill 5/21/10 94.5 Y Food stored in incorrect order, hot water unavailable, unclean fan covers and walk-in cooler shelves
Los Potrillos 5/27/10 97 Y Cold food held at warm temperatures, tomatoes left out more than 2 hours after preparation, no handwashing signs in bathrooms
Mama Dip’s 5/28/10 95 Y Chicken held at room temperature, cold foods held at 64 degrees, yams stored in beverage refrigeration unit, dripping walk-in cooler
McAlister’s Deli 11/15/10 97 Y Salad and cheese not held at sufficiently cool temperatures, distorted walk-in freezer, broken tiles in ladies’ room
McDonald’s 11/11/10 100 Y No sanitizer for food contact surfaces, dirty sink gasket
Mediterranean Deli 5/4/10 94.5 Y Cold foods held at warm temperatures, hot water unavailable, unlabeled foods
Mint 5/28/10 95.5 Y Ice scoop stored incorrectly, food stored on floor, pika material on floor, uncontained cocoa
Noodles & Company 6/8/10 101 N Dishes not dried before stacking
Oriental Garden 5/7/10 96.5 Y Employees with uncovered drinks near food, sanitizer at wrong strength
P.T.s Grille 8/24/10 97.5 Y Insufficient sanitizer, hot water unavailable, walls around potato cutter unclean, unclean bar gun nozzles, unclean beer cooler
Panera Bread 4/19/10 99.5 N dishes not dried before stacking, unclean gaskets
Pantana Bob’s 3/19/10 96 Y Missing ice bin cover, food splatter on walls, rusted, chipping shelves
Papa John’s 7/14/10 99.5 N Scoop handles in contact with food
Penang 4/15/10 96.5 Y sanitizer at wrong strength, insufficient thermometers, noodles and chicken stored in plastic grocery bags, multiple surfaces unclean
Pepper’s Pizza 1/21/11 93 Y Employee scooping ice with cup, wet dishes stacked, rust in walk-in cooler, mold in hand-washing sink, hole in men’s room wall needs repairing
Qdoba Mexican Grill 4/7/10 96.5 Y mold accumulation in ice machine, sirloin thawed in water, sugar and salt unlabeled
Quiznos Subs 10/29/10 90 Y Employees didn’t wash hands, mildew in lemonade dispenser, subway ingredients not held at sufficiently cool temperatures
R&R Grill 8/20/10 99 Y Mildew in ice machine, cracked spatulas, weak sanitizer, mops stored on floor
Recovery Room 5/26/10 97.5 Y Mildew in ice machine, unapproved chopper, black cups wrongly used to dispense dressing
Sakura Xpress 9/13/10 94 Y No lid on employee beverage, margarine buckets used to form a stand, shrimp too warm to serve, no time record kept for cooked sushi, perspiring food handler without hair restraint
Sandwhich 5/11/10 97 Y No chlorine for dish washer, food remnants on potato cutter, 3 bottles of chemicals unlabeled, missing hand-washing signs
Spanky’s 9/13/10 95 Y Cheese, cantaloupe, tomatoes, eggs, slaw all stored at too-warm temperatures, dirty linen stored in refrigerated work station, unclean back of refrigerator, warped ceiling tiles
Starbucks 8/11/09 97.5 Y Flies in service areas, sanitizer improperly mixed, slime mold in drains beneath equipment
Sugarland 2/18/10 97 Y Butter kept at insufficiently cool temperature, hot water unavailable, no handwashing sign in men’s room
Sutton’s Drugstore 7/1/10 92 Y Chlorine sanitizer too strong, tap water insufficiently warm, chicken strips stored beneath ventilation hood, cooked hot dogs kept at room temperature, ice cream freezer has spillage and dirty cardboard
Talulla’s 10/21/10 95.5 Y Sandwiches, meat, and chicken not held at sufficiently cold temperatures, pitchers improperly stored in the ice machine, dirty floors
The Crunkleton 3/8/10 99 N Inadequate lighting, items stored on floor
The Library 3/5/10 97 Y Pink slime mold growing in drink dispensers, solo cups being re-used
The Pita Pit 11/19/10 97.5 Y Mildew in ice machine, no sanitizer in pita preparation area, improper spoon storage in gyro meat and eggs containers
Time Out 8/3/10 95 Y Whole turkey kept at prep table at insufficiently hot temperature, disposable cup used to portion out sugar, unclean coffee maker and sweet tea urn
Top of the Hill 5/25/10 97 Y mold buildup in ice machine, heavy rust in prep cooler, unlabeled chemicals
Vespa 4/21/10 97.5 Y Potatoes stored under pipe in prep kitchen, chipped shelves, unclean fan guard
Vimala’s Curry Blossom Café 7/16/10 99 N Improper transfer of opened bags of rice, no test strips to test dish washing sanitization levels
West End Wine Bar 3/5/10 94 Y Dish washing machine not sanitizing due to faulty supply line, unapproved flooring and flooring in disrepair
Windows at the Franklin Hotel 6/15/10 98.5 N Dishes not dried before stacking, broken gasket, unclean fan guard, linen towel improperly used to dry employee hands at hand sink (paper towels required)
Ye Olde Waffle Shop 5/21/10 100.5 N Standing water garbage can wash area, dirty mop water dumped in interior sink, grout in dish washing machine
Yofrutt Frozen Yogurt 7/13/10 96.5 Y Open cans of fruit showing rust, no sanitizer in kitchen, unapproved onion chopper and smoothie maker

  1. Do you know what the maximum grade is?
    I thought it was 100, but since Noodles & Company got a 101 and Ye Olde Waffle Shop got a 100.5, it looks like my assumption was wrong…

    Comment by Roxane on February 2, 2011 at 1:03 pm

  2. Roxane, the maximum score for the health inspection is 100, but as mentioned in the article, "two points can be gained on the final grade if an on-site manager has passed an approved training course and the corresponding test." So the maximum possible score is 102.

    -Shane

    Comment by Shane on February 2, 2011 at 1:49 pm

  3. Great piece, Shane! Perhaps there's a business opportunity in going around offering to clean the mold from restaurants' ice machines. They just can't seem to get a handle on that.

  4. Peppers gave me really bad food poisoning a while ago and I was super sick for days. This article is really good. I always thought an A rating was good. Turns out you can still have slime mold and a critical violation and still get an a. That doesn’t make any sense.

    Comment by Sarah on February 2, 2011 at 2:26 pm

    Comment by crashdavis on February 3, 2011 at 8:41 am

  7. @Crashdavis, that is probably because Cosmic did not have a "critical violation" but Carrburritos did. There is a column for Y/N concerning "critical" violations. My guess is that it was more critical that Carrburritos did not store a food item at the correct temperature, whereas Cosmic's offenses did not compromise the integrity of food items.
